== Installing Ubuntu Precise (12.04.2), Saucy (13.10) and Trusty (14.04) using netboot for Calxeda ECX-1000 (Highbank) and ECX-2000 (Midway) ==

=== Before You Begin ===

You will need the following:
1. A management device for console access
2. DHCP available which will provide Internet access (to access the Ubuntu package archive)
3. A <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/Netboot|TFTP Server]]</nowiki> accessible from the system

=== Downloading the Installer ===

Download the Calxeda Highbank kernel and installer initrd and place them on an available <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/Netboot|TFTP Server]]</nowiki>.

For Precise, use this <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/precise-updates/main/installer-armhf/current/images/highbank/netboot/vmlinuz|kernel]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/precise-updates/main/installer-armhf/current/images/highbank/netboot/initrd.gz|initrd]]</nowiki>.

For Saucy Highbank, use this <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/saucy/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic/netboot/vmlinuz|kernel]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/saucy/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic/netboot/initrd.gz|initrd]]</nowiki>.

For Saucy Midway, use this <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/saucy/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic-lpae/netboot/vmlinuz|kernel]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/saucy/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic-lpae/netboot/initrd.gz|initrd]]</nowiki>.

For Trusty Highbank, use this <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/trusty/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic/netboot/vmlinuz|kernel]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/trusty/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic/netboot/initrd.gz|initrd]]</nowiki>.

For Trusty Midway, use this <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/trusty/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic-lpae/netboot/vmlinuz|kernel]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-ports/dists/trusty/main/installer-armhf/current/images/generic-lpae/netboot/initrd.gz|initrd]]</nowiki>.

=== Booting the Installer on Highbank ===

Power on the chassis and access the console via IPMI (e.g. "ipmitool -H 10.0.0.101 -U admin -P admin -I lanplus sol activate").

Power on the system processor (e.g. "ipmitool -U admin -P admin -H 10.0.0.101 chassis power on").

Interrupt U-Boot by pressing Enter when prompted to stop autoboot. In some instances you will need to press "s" to stop autoboot

Type the following at the U-Boot prompt, replacing the IP address with the IP address of your TFTP Server:
<pre>
dhcp
tftpboot ${kernel_addr_r} 10.0.0.10:/vmlinuz
tftpboot ${ramdisk_addr_r} 10.0.0.10:/initrd.gz
setenv bootargs "console=ttyAMA0"
bootz ${kernel_addr_r} ${ramdisk_addr_r}:${filesize} ${fdt_addr}
</pre>

Note: insert "setenv initrd_high 0xffffffff" after "dhcp" for early u-boot releases.

This will boot into the installer, follow the default partitioning scheme suggested.

=== Booting the Installer on Midway ===

Power on the chassis and access the console via IPMI (e.g. "ipmitool -H 10.0.0.101 -U admin -P admin -I lanplus sol activate").

Power on the system processor (e.g. "ipmitool -U admin -P admin -H 10.0.0.101 chassis power on").

Interrupt U-Boot by pressing Enter when prompted to stop autoboot. In some instances you will need to press "s" to stop autoboot

Type the following at the U-Boot prompt, replacing the IP address with the IP address of your TFTP Server:

<pre>
dhcp
fdt addr 1000
fdt set / model "Calxeda ECX-2000"
tftpboot ${kernel_addr_r} 10.0.0.10:/vmlinuz
tftpboot ${ramdisk_addr_r} 10.0.0.10:/initrd.gz
setenv bootargs "console=ttyAMA0"
bootz ${kernel_addr_r} ${ramdisk_addr_r}:${filesize} ${fdt_addr}
</pre>

This will boot into the installer, follow the default partitioning scheme suggested.

=== Booting into the Installed System ===

Your system should now boot into the installed system.
